page.title: 04Horse Training Stables
page.content: Jeremy Tree has lived in Beckhampton for thirty two years. Since his early years he has been interested in horses. After leaving school he became a banker. He fought in the Second World War. After the war he purchased the famous stables at Beckhampton. At present he has sixty horses in training and these can be seen every morning galloping across the downs near the stables or racing around the training course. Mr Tree has five trainers working for him and twenty five jockeys or stable lads. Each jockey rides two or three horses a day. He retains the famous jockey Pat Eddery as his main rider, and has engaged Lester Piggott and other well known riders to race for him. This June(1985)one of Mr Trees horses came third in the most famous of classic races The Derby.
